intro: Lepturus boinensis, commonly known as the Bornean arrowhead, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
